name: John Kerry- Before the Senate Multiple Choice Quiz | U.S. Government | 20 Questions

questions.text: John Kerry has Irish ancestry.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Instead, Kerry's surname, according to family stories, comes from when his grandfather, Fritz Kohn, changed his name to avoid anti-Semitism- a randomly-pointed pencil aimed at a map hit County Kerry in Ireland.

questions.text: John Kerry's paternal grandparents were born Jewish.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Kerry's paternal grandfather, Frederick A. Kerry, was born Fritz Kohn, in the town of Horni Benesov, which is now in the Czech Republic. Frederick's wife, Ida Loewe, was born in Budapest, Hungary. The couple converted to Catholicism in 1901.

questions.text: Kerry's maternal grandfather was from the powerful Forbes family. From what substance did he make much of his fortune?
questions.explanation:
Opium.

	James Grant Forbes was born in China, and profited greatly from the opium trade.

questions.text: To whom is John Kerry related through his maternal grandmother, Margaret Winthrop?
questions.explanation:
George W. Bush

	Bush is Kerry's 9th cousin, twice removed.

questions.text: Kerry attended a succession of private schools in several countries. The last school, from which he graduated, was St. Paul's School in Concord, New Hampshire. What sport did he NOT participate in during his prep school years?
questions.explanation:
Yacht racing.

	Kerry bicycled over much of Europe during his childhood. He later also took up fencing and soccer.

questions.text: When not playing sports, what other activity occupied some of Kerry's prep school years?
questions.explanation:
Playing in a rock band.

	Kerry played electric bass in a rock band called the Electras. Their one record was not a hit, it sold only 500 copies.

questions.text: In 1962, Kerry participated in his first political campaign. For whom did he work?
questions.explanation:
Edward Kennedy.

	Edward Kennedy was running for the Senate. During this campaign, Kerry also met John Kennedy.

questions.text: What job did John Kerry hold during college at Yale University?
options: He did not work during college
questions.explanation:
Door-to-door encyclopedia salesman.

	He also loaded grocery trucks.

questions.text: Like George W. Bush, Kerry was a member of the secret Skull and Bones Society at Yale.
questions.explanation:
True.

	One of only 15 students per year to be nominated. Kerry was chosen primarily because of his political potential.

questions.text: John Kerry was drafted into service for the Vietnam War.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He volunteered for military service after graduation from Yale.

questions.text: In which branch of the armed forces did Kerry serve during the Vietnam War?
questions.explanation:
Navy.

	He served in the military from 1966-1970.

questions.text: In what part of his body does Kerry still carry shrapnel from the war?
options: None- his injuries were only scratches
questions.explanation:
Left thigh.

	His boat was hit by a rocket-propelled grenade on the Bo De River. Doctors opted to stitch the wound shut, with the shrapnel still inside, rather than make a large incision.

questions.text: Kerry was awarded the Silver Star, for exceptional gallantry in battle against foreign forces, in 1969. What did he do to earn this award?
questions.correct: Defended his Swift Boat as well as another from a Viet Cong ambush
options: Rescued several captured soldiers from a Viet Cong camp
Recaptured a Swift Boat that had been captured by enemy forces
Piloted his Swift Boat through enemy fire to apprehend a Viet Cong leader
questions.explanation:
Defended his Swift Boat as well as another from a Viet Cong ambush.

	The boats were ambushed on the Bay Hap River. Kerry led his men ashore and destroyed the enemy positions without sustaining any casualties.

questions.text: John Kerry never actually killed anyone in combat.
questions.explanation:
False.

	During the battle for which he was awarded the Silver Star, Kerry pursued a wounded Viet Cong soldier, who was armed with a rocket launcher, and killed him.

questions.text: When Kerry returned from the Vietnam War, he became one of the strongest protesters against the war. In his testimony before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee in 1971, what did he NOT claim?
questions.correct: That he had witnessed war crimes
options: That returning veterans were not getting the support that they needed
That the war in Vietnam did not pose any threats to the US
That the reasons for the war were political; Nixon did not want to lose
questions.explanation:
That he had witnessed war crimes.

	Although Kerry spoke of the terrible atrocities that others had witnessed, he did not claim to have seen any war crimes himself.

questions.text: Charles Colson, adviser to president Richard Nixon, feared that the charismatic young Kerry could turn public opinion against the war. In a memo to Nixon, he wrote, "Destroy the young demagogue before he becomes another __________." (Which name completes the quote?)
questions.explanation:
Ralph Nader.

	Unlike many of the bearded, unkempt hippies associated with the anti-war protests, Kerry was articulate, good-looking, and heroic.

questions.text: As an anti-war protester, Kerry was arrested.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Kerry and 440 other protesters were arrested for trespassing at a demonstration in Lexington, Massachusetts in 1971.

questions.text: John Kerry graduated from the Boston College Law School in 1976. What was the first legal job that he held?
options: Partner in the law firm of the Environmental Defense Fund
Assistant attorney for a large Boston pharmaceutical company
questions.explanation:
Prosecutor for Middlesex County, Massachusetts.

	He worked for the District Attorney's office during law school and accepted a full-time position after graduation.

questions.text: Kerry left his first position after college in 1978 to form a private law firm. He ran another business in Boston at the same time. What was it?
questions.explanation:
A bakery.

	"Kilvert & Forbes" sold mostly sweets like cookies. The business still exists today (although no longer owned by Kerry) as "Maggie's Sweets," and provided cookies to the 2004 Democratic Convention.

questions.text: What was the first public office to which Kerry was elected?
questions.explanation:
Lieutenant Governor of Massachusetts.

	Kerry achieved this position in 1982, with Michael Dukakis as governor.
